analyzed: dper na sgyu mar byas pa'i glang po che la sogs pa dang / nor dang 'bru la sogs pa ni ji ltar snang ba de ltar med la /

translated: The characteristic of error is that which is non-existent and existent in the aspect of a post and a man, respectively, is not seen and is seen. It is not seen in the world in this way.

translated: It is said: If either non-existence or appearance is absent, error, non-error, affliction and purification are not tenable.

analyzed: gal te med pa kho nar gyur te snang bar ma gyur na ni de med pas 'khrul par mi 'gyur te /

analyzed: med pa ni med pa nyid du ma 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //

original: 'khrul pa med na ni ma 'khrul pa yang med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'khrul pa med na ni ma 'khrul pa yang med par 'gyur te /
translated: If there were no error, then non-error would not exist,

original: ma 'khrul pa ni de sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma 'khrul pa ni de sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because non-error is preceded by that.

original: des na kun nas nyon mongs pa yang med par 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: des na kun nas nyon mongs pa yang med par 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: Therefore, there would be no affliction,

original: de ni 'khrul pa'i rgyu can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni 'khrul pa'i rgyu can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that is the cause of error.

original: de med na rnam par byang bar yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de med na rnam par byang bar yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: If that does not exist, then there would be no purification,

original: rnam par byang ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because purification is preceded by affliction.

original: de'i phyir de med na 'bad pa med par grol bar 'gyur bas na mngon sum dang 'gal lo //
analyzed: de'i phyir de med na 'bad pa med par grol bar 'gyur bas na mngon sum dang 'gal lo //
translated: Therefore, since one would be liberated without effort if that does not exist, this contradicts direct perception.

original: 'on te snang ba kho nar 'gyur gyi med par ma gyur na /
analyzed: 'on te snang ba kho nar 'gyur gyi med par ma gyur na /
translated: But if it is only an appearance and does not become nonexistent,

original: de lta na yang med pa med pas 'khrul par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na yang med pa med pas 'khrul par mi 'gyur te /
translated: then, since nonexistence does not exist, there would be no error,

original: snang ba de'i bdag nyid du yongs su grub na ma 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snang ba de'i bdag nyid du yongs su grub na ma 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that appearance would be fully established as its nature and there would be no error.

original: 'khrul pa @29b med na snga ma bzhin lhag mar yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'khrul pa @29b med na snga ma bzhin lhag mar yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If there were no error, then, as before, the remainder would not exist.

original: de'i phyir skyes bu'i byed pa don med par 'gyur bas rigs pa dang 'gal lo //
analyzed: de'i phyir skyes bu'i byed pa don med par 'gyur bas rigs pa dang 'gal lo //
translated: Therefore, since the activity of a person would be pointless, it contradicts reasoning.

original: 'jig rten na yang de ltar so sor grub pa'i mtho yor dang / skyes bu dag la 'khrul par ming 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten na yang de ltar so sor grub pa'i mtho yor dang / skyes bu dag la 'khrul par ming 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And in the world, a post and a person are designated with the name of the other due to confusion.

original: gnyis dang mngon par brjod pa ji ltar snang ba chos kyi mtshan nyid dang / de khyad par med pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid bshad zin to //üîΩde ltar yin na ci chos dang chos nyid dag gcig nyid du khas blang bar byas pa'am /
analyzed: gnyis dang mngon par brjod pa ji ltar snang ba chos kyi mtshan nyid dang / de khyad par med pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid bshad zin to // de ltar yin na ci chos dang chos nyid dag gcig nyid du khas blang bar byas pa'am /
translated: Thus, the characteristics of phenomena and the characteristics of phenomena that are not different from that have been explained, as they appear in the scriptures.

original: 'on te tha dad pa nyid du snyam na /
analyzed: 'on te tha dad pa nyid du snyam na /
translated: If that is so, should phenomena and their true nature be accepted as the same or different?üîΩIt is said:

original: gsungs pa / gnyis po dag ni gcig nyid ma yin zhing so so nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: gsungs pa / gnyis po dag ni gcig nyid ma yin zhing so so nyid ma yin te /
translated: The two are not the same, nor are they different.

original: yod pa dang med pa dag khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa dag khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because existence and nonexistence are not different.

original: gnyis po dag ces bya ba chos dang chos nyid dag ni gcig pa nyid dang tha dad pa nyid du mi 'dod do //
analyzed: gnyis po dag ces bya ba chos dang chos nyid dag ni gcig pa nyid dang tha dad pa nyid du mi 'dod do //
translated: The two, phenomena and their true nature, are not asserted to be the same or different.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: yod pa dang med pa dag kyang khyad par yod pa dang khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa dag kyang khyad par yod pa dang khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because of the difference and non-difference of existence and non-existence.

original: re zhig chos dang chos nyid du mi 'thad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: re zhig chos dang chos nyid du mi 'thad pa ma yin te /
translated: First, it is not untenable that the dharmas are the dharmata,

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: why is it so?

original: yod pa dang med pa dag khyad par yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa dag khyad par yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because of the difference and non-difference of existence and non-existence.

original: chos nyid ni yod pa yin la chos ni med pa yin pas yod pa dang med pa khyad par can dag ci ltar gcig nyid du gyur ;
analyzed: chos nyid ni yod pa yin la chos ni med pa yin pas yod pa dang med pa khyad par can dag ci ltar gcig nyid du gyur ;
translated: The dharmata is existent, and the dharmas are non-existent. How can existence and non-existence be the same?

original: tha dad pa nyid kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: tha dad pa nyid kyang ma yin no //
translated: They are not different.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: yod pa dang med pa dag khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa dag khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the non-difference of existence and non-existence.

original: ji ltar khyad par med ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar khyad par med ce na /
translated: How is there non-difference?

original: chos nyid ni chos med pa tsam gyis rab tu phye ba yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: chos nyid ni chos med pa tsam gyis rab tu phye ba yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the dharmata is distinguished by the mere absence of the dharmas,

original: gzung ba la sogs pa'i khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzung ba la sogs pa'i khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no difference in the apprehended object, etc.

original: chos dang chos nyid dag gcig ma yin pa dang / so so ma yin pa nyid bshad zin to //
analyzed: chos dang chos nyid dag gcig ma yin pa dang / so so ma yin pa nyid bshad zin to //
translated: It has been explained that the dharmas and the dharmata are neither the same nor different.

original: 'on kyang de ltar tha dad pa med pa de dag las ji ltar chos de la zhugs pa'am /
analyzed: 'on kyang de ltar tha dad pa med pa de dag las ji ltar chos de la zhugs pa'am /
translated: However, how can one engage in the Dharma from among those that are not separate?

original: ji ltar legs par zhugs par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar legs par zhugs par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: But how can one enter into that Dharma, or how can one enter it well, from those that are not different in that way?üîΩIt is said:

original: gsungs pa / rnam pa drug gis chos la 'jug pa bla na med pa zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: gsungs pa / rnam pa drug gis chos la 'jug pa bla na med pa zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: The unexcelled entry into the Dharma is by way of six aspects.

original: 'chad par 'gyur ba rnam pa drug gis so //
analyzed: 'chad par 'gyur ba rnam pa drug gis so //
translated: It is by way of the six aspects that will be explained.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: mtshan nyid dang / grub pa dang / gcig nyid ma yin zhing so so ba nyid ma yin pa dang / gnas thun mong ba dang / thun mong ma yin pa dang / gzung ba dang 'dzin par snang ba med pa la 'jug pas so //
analyzed: mtshan nyid dang / grub pa dang / gcig nyid ma yin zhing so so ba nyid ma yin pa dang / gnas thun mong ba dang / thun mong ma yin pa dang / gzung ba dang 'dzin par snang ba med pa la 'jug pas so //
translated: Entry into the characteristics, accomplishment, non-difference and non-separateness, common abode, uncommon abode, and the non-appearance of apprehended object and apprehending subject.

original: @30a * // de la mtshan nyid dang / grub pa dang / gcig nyid ma yin zhing so so ba nyid ma yin pa ni mdo ji lta ba bzhin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: @30a * // de la mtshan nyid dang / grub pa dang / gcig nyid ma yin zhing so so ba nyid ma yin pa ni mdo ji lta ba bzhin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: Among them, the characteristics, accomplishment, non-difference and non-separateness are as in the sutra.

original: gsum po 'di ni mdo ji lta ba bzhin du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: gsum po 'di ni mdo ji lta ba bzhin du rig par bya ste /
translated: These three should be understood as they are in the sutra.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: mtshan nyid dang / grub pa dang / gcig nyid ma yin zhing so so ba nyid ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid dang / grub pa dang / gcig nyid ma yin zhing so so ba nyid ma yin pa'o //
translated: The characteristic, the establishment, and the non-difference and non-separateness.

original: mtshan nyid ni gnyis dang / ji ltar mngon par brjod par snang ba yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun tu rtog pa ste /
analyzed: mtshan nyid ni gnyis dang / ji ltar mngon par brjod par snang ba yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun tu rtog pa ste /
translated: The characteristic is the duality and the imagination of what is unreal, just as it appears in verbal expressions.

original: chos kyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: chos kyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: This is the characteristic of the dharmas.

original: grub pa ni med pa dang snang ba dag las gang yang rung ba zhig med na 'khrul pa dang / ma 'khrul pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba mi 'thad pa'i nyes par 'gyur bas /
analyzed: grub pa ni med pa dang snang ba dag las gang yang rung ba zhig med na 'khrul pa dang / ma 'khrul pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba mi 'thad pa'i nyes par 'gyur bas /
translated: The establishment is that if either the non-existence or the appearance were to be non-existent, the error and the non-error, the defilement and the purification would be untenable.

original: de gnyi ga khas blangs pas 'bras bu dang bcas pa grub pa'o //
analyzed: de gnyi ga khas blangs pas 'bras bu dang bcas pa grub pa'o //
translated: Therefore, because both are accepted, the establishment is fruitful.

original: gcig nyid ma yin zhing so so ba nyid ma yin pa ni yod pa dang med pa dag khyad par yod pa dang khyad par med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gcig nyid ma yin zhing so so ba nyid ma yin pa ni yod pa dang med pa dag khyad par yod pa dang khyad par med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The non-difference and non-separateness is because of the difference and non-difference of existence and non-existence.

original: mdo ji lta ba bzhin no //
analyzed: mdo ji lta ba bzhin no //
translated: This is just as in the sutra.

original: gnas ni gang zhig gang du 'khod pa de ni gnas ma yin te /
analyzed: gnas ni gang zhig gang du 'khod pa de ni gnas ma yin te /
translated: The abode is that which is not the abode, because it is not the abode of that which is situated there.

original: sems can gyi khams dang 'jig rten gyi khams so //
analyzed: sems can gyi khams dang 'jig rten gyi khams so //
translated: The realm of sentient beings and the realm of the world.

original: de la gang zhig 'khor ba dang gang du 'khor ba de ni chos kyi gnas yin no //
analyzed: de la gang zhig 'khor ba dang gang du 'khor ba de ni chos kyi gnas yin no //
translated: The realm of phenomena is that in which there is cyclic existence and that through which there is cyclic existence.

original: de yang rim pa ji lta ba bzhin brten pa dang / rten gyi ngo bo dngos po sems can gyi khams dang / 'jig rten gyi khams so //
analyzed: de yang rim pa ji lta ba bzhin brten pa dang / rten gyi ngo bo dngos po sems can gyi khams dang / 'jig rten gyi khams so //
translated: And that is, respectively, the realm of sentient beings and the realm of the world, which are the basis and the entity based upon it.

original: de la 'jig rten gyi khams ni thun mong ba lta bu'i rnam par rig pa ste /
analyzed: de la 'jig rten gyi khams ni thun mong ba lta bu'i rnam par rig pa ste /
translated: The realm of the world is the representation that is common to all.

original: rgyud so sor sems can thams cad la der snang ba'i rnam par shes pa skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyud so sor sems can thams cad la der snang ba'i rnam par shes pa skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the consciousness that appears as that arises in the mindstreams of all sentient beings.

original: de yang cig shos ni sems can gyi khams so //
analyzed: de yang cig shos ni sems can gyi khams so //
translated: The other is the realm of sentient beings.

original: de yang thun mong dang thun mong ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de yang thun mong dang thun mong ma yin pa'o //
translated: And that is common and uncommon.

original: de yang skye ba dang / tha snyad dang / phan pa dang / gnod pa dang / yon tan dang skyon ni phan tshun bdag po nyid kyis phan tshun rgyu yin pa'i phyir thun mong ba'o //
analyzed: de yang skye ba dang / tha snyad dang / phan pa dang / gnod pa dang / yon tan dang skyon ni phan tshun bdag po nyid kyis phan tshun rgyu yin pa'i phyir thun mong ba'o //
translated: And that is common because birth, designation, benefit, harm, virtue, and vice are mutually causal through the relation of mutual dominance.

original: skye ba dang lta ba la sogs pa'i tha snyad dang / phan pa dang / gnod pa dang ; yon tan dang skyon rgyud so so la yod pa rnams ni phan tshun der snang ba'i rnam par shes pa skye ba la bdag po nyid kyis phan tshun rgyu yin pa'i phyir sems can gyi khams thun mong ba zhes brjod do //
analyzed: skye ba dang lta ba la sogs pa'i tha snyad dang / phan pa dang / gnod pa dang ; yon tan dang skyon rgyud so so la yod pa rnams ni phan tshun der snang ba'i rnam par shes pa skye ba la bdag po nyid kyis phan tshun rgyu yin pa'i phyir sems can gyi khams thun mong ba zhes brjod do //
translated: The conventions of birth, seeing, etc., and the benefits, harms, good qualities, and faults that exist in individual continuums are said to be the common realm of sentient beings because they are mutually causes in the arising of consciousness appearing as those objects through the power of being dominant conditions.

original: phan tshun rgyu yin pa'i phyir zhes bya bas grub bzhin du bdag po smos pa ni dmigs pa'i rgyu @30b gsal ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: phan tshun rgyu yin pa'i phyir zhes bya bas grub bzhin du bdag po smos pa ni dmigs pa'i rgyu @30b gsal ba'i don du'o //
translated: The mention of dominant condition is for the purpose of clarifying the cause of the object, since they are mutually causes.

original: 'di thun mong ma yin pa ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: 'di thun mong ma yin pa ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is this uncommon?üîΩIt is said:

original: gsungs pa / gnas dang / rnam par rig pa dang / las dang / bde sdug dang / 'chi 'pho ba dang / skye ba dang / bcings pa dang / grol ba ni thun mong ma yin pas na thun mong ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gsungs pa / gnas dang / rnam par rig pa dang / las dang / bde sdug dang / 'chi 'pho ba dang / skye ba dang / bcings pa dang / grol ba ni thun mong ma yin pas na thun mong ma yin pa'o //
translated: Since the abode, perception, action, pleasure and pain, death and rebirth, bondage, and liberation are uncommon, they are uncommon.

original: de la gnas ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: de la gnas ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: Among them, the abode is the foundation consciousness.

original: der snang ba'i rnam par rig pa'i bag chags rnams ni de la gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: der snang ba'i rnam par rig pa'i bag chags rnams ni de la gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The latent impressions of the representations that appear as those are located there.

original: rnam par rig pa ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rig pa ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: The representations are the actual consciousnesses.

original: las ni dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa'o //üîΩlhag ma ni mdo ji lta ba /
analyzed: las ni dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa'o // lhag ma ni mdo ji lta ba /
translated: The actions are virtuous, nonvirtuous, and indeterminate.

original: bzhin du rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: bzhin du rtogs par bya'o //
translated: The rest should be understood as in the sutra.

original: de la gnas la sogs pa rnams ni lus can ma yin pa'i phyir dang / so sor rig par bya ba yin pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: de la gnas la sogs pa rnams ni lus can ma yin pa'i phyir dang / so sor rig par bya ba yin pa'i phyir na /
translated: Since those located there and so on are not physical, and since they are individually cognized,

original: phan tshun rgyud so sor der snang ba'i rnam par rig pa skye ba'i rgyu ma yin pas sems can gyi khams thun mong ma yin pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: phan tshun rgyud so sor der snang ba'i rnam par rig pa skye ba'i rgyu ma yin pas sems can gyi khams thun mong ma yin pa zhes brjod do //
translated: they are not the causes for the arising of the representations that appear there in each individual continuum. Therefore they are called the uncommon realm of sentient beings.

original: lus ngag gi las kyi rnam par rig pa dag phan tshun der snang ba rnam par rig pa skye ba'i rgyu yin yang tha snyad kyis ma bsdus pa ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: lus ngag gi las kyi rnam par rig pa dag phan tshun der snang ba rnam par rig pa skye ba'i rgyu yin yang tha snyad kyis ma bsdus pa ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why are the representations of the actions of body and speech not the causes for the arising of the representations that appear there in each other, even though they are included in conventions?

original: brjod pa / lus ngag gi rnam par rig pa tha snyad kyis ni bsdus mod kyi /
analyzed: brjod pa / lus ngag gi rnam par rig pa tha snyad kyis ni bsdus mod kyi /
translated: It is said: Although the representations of body and speech are included in the conventional,

original: de las kyi rnam par rig pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de las kyi rnam par rig pa ni ma yin no //
translated: they are not representations of karma.

original: 'dir ni dge ba dang mi dge ba nyid gang gis de las nyid du rtogs par 'gyur ba de'i dbang du byas pa ste bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir ni dge ba dang mi dge ba nyid gang gis de las nyid du rtogs par 'gyur ba de'i dbang du byas pa ste bstan pa yin no //
translated: Here, the virtuous and nonvirtuous natures are taken as the basis for understanding karma, and are taught.

original: der snang ba'i rnam par rig pa de yang phan tshun du der snang ba'i rnam par rig pa skye ba'i rgyu ma yin pas na lus ngag gi las kyi rnam par rig pa yang thun mong ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: der snang ba'i rnam par rig pa de yang phan tshun du der snang ba'i rnam par rig pa skye ba'i rgyu ma yin pas na lus ngag gi las kyi rnam par rig pa yang thun mong ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: And the representation that appears as that is not the cause for the arising of the representation that appears as that, so the representation of the karma of body and speech is also not shared.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin par snang ba med pa la 'jug pa ni gzung bar snang ba med pa la 'jug par 'gyur ba des na gzung bar snang ba med pa la 'jug pa'i dbang du byas te gsungs pa /
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin par snang ba med pa la 'jug pa ni gzung bar snang ba med pa la 'jug par 'gyur ba des na gzung bar snang ba med pa la 'jug pa'i dbang du byas te gsungs pa /
translated: The engagement in the absence of the appearance of apprehended object and apprehending subject is the engagement in the absence of the appearance of the apprehended object. Therefore, with reference to the engagement in the absence of the appearance of the apprehended object, it is said:

original: phyi rol gyi gzung ba thun mong par snang ba 'dzin pa'i rnam par rig pa la rnam par shes ba las phyi rol gyi don med de /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi gzung ba thun mong par snang ba 'dzin pa'i rnam par rig pa la rnam par shes ba las phyi rol gyi don med de /
translated: The external object that is perceived in common does not exist as an external object apart from the consciousness that apprehends it.

original: thun mong pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir snod kyi rnam par rig par snang ba 'dzin pa'i rnam par rig pa nyid rgyud so so la skye ba de'i phyir ro //üîΩ'dzin pa'i rnam par rig par gyur pa la der snang ba'i rnam par shes pa las phyir rol tu gyur pa @31a * //
analyzed: thun mong pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir snod kyi rnam par rig par snang ba 'dzin pa'i rnam par rig pa nyid rgyud so so la skye ba de'i phyir ro // 'dzin pa'i rnam par rig par gyur pa la der snang ba'i rnam par shes pa las phyir rol tu gyur pa @31a * //
translated: Because it is perceived in common, that is, because the consciousness that apprehends the appearance of the vessel arises in each individual mindstream.üîΩThe consciousness that appears as the object does not exist as an external object apart from the consciousness that appears as the subject.

original: 'dzin pa'i rnam par rig par gyur pa gzhan yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i rnam par rig par gyur pa gzhan yod pa ma yin la /
translated: There is no other consciousness that appears as the subject apart from the consciousness that appears as the object.

original: rnam par rig pa de nyid kyang gzhan gyi yul du 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rig pa de nyid kyang gzhan gyi yul du 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: And that very consciousness does not become the object of another.

original: gang gi phyir snod kyi rnam par rig pa thun mong pa yin pas na rgyud so so la der snang ba'i rnam par rig pa skye ba de'i phyir gcig gi rnam par rig pa gang yin pa de gzhan gyi yul du 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir snod kyi rnam par rig pa thun mong pa yin pas na rgyud so so la der snang ba'i rnam par rig pa skye ba de'i phyir gcig gi rnam par rig pa gang yin pa de gzhan gyi yul du 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: Because the common appearance of the object is the same for all, the appearance of the object is the same for all. Therefore, the consciousness of one is not the object of another.

original: des na don med do //
analyzed: des na don med do //
translated: Thus, there is no object.

original: sems can gyi khams thun mong pa'i gzung ba rnam par rig pa yang 'dis bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: sems can gyi khams thun mong pa'i gzung ba rnam par rig pa yang 'dis bsal ba yin no //
translated: This also refutes the idea that the appearance of the object is the common appearance of the object for the mental continua of many sentient beings.

original: cig shos thun mong ma yin pa'i gzung ba rnam par rig pa'i don gang yin pa gzhan gyi sems dang sems las byung ba zhes bya ba de yang mnyam par ma bzhag pa dang / mnyam par bzhag pa'i 'dzin pa'i rnam par rig pa rnam pa gnyi ga yang phan tshun yul du 'gyur ba ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: cig shos thun mong ma yin pa'i gzung ba rnam par rig pa'i don gang yin pa gzhan gyi sems dang sems las byung ba zhes bya ba de yang mnyam par ma bzhag pa dang / mnyam par bzhag pa'i 'dzin pa'i rnam par rig pa rnam pa gnyi ga yang phan tshun yul du 'gyur ba ma yin pa ste /
translated: The other is the appearance of the object that is not common to all. This is the consciousness of the mind and mental factors of another. analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

original: mnyam par ma bzhag pa la ni /

analyzed: gang gi phyir mnyam par ma bzhag pa la rang gi rnam par rtog pa las snang ba'i gzung ba rang gi rnam par rig pa nyid yul du 'gyur ba de'i phyir gzhan gyi sems la sogs pa de'i yul ma yin no // cig shos mnyam par bzhag pa la yang ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul la de'i gzugs brnyan snang ba'i phyir gzhan gyi sems la sogs pa yul ma yin no zhes rjes su 'jug go //

original: gang gi phyir mnyam par bzhag pa'i rnam par rig pa la yang ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul de'i gzugs brnyan du snang ba'i rnam par rig pa nyid yul du 'gyur ba de'i phyir de'i yul yang gzhan gyi sems la sogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir mnyam par bzhag pa'i rnam par rig pa la yang ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul de'i gzugs brnyan du snang ba'i rnam par rig pa nyid yul du 'gyur ba de'i phyir de'i yul yang gzhan gyi sems la sogs pa ma yin no //
translated: Because in the perception of the concentrated state, the object is only the perception that appears as the reflection of the object of concentration, therefore, the object is not the mind of another, etc.

original: de lta na yang rang gi rnam par rig pa nyid yul yin pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa las phyi rol du gyur pa'i don med la de med pa'i phyir gzung bar snang ba med do //
analyzed: de lta na yang rang gi rnam par rig pa nyid yul yin pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa las phyi rol du gyur pa'i don med la de med pa'i phyir gzung bar snang ba med do //

analyzed: gzung bar snang ba de med par grub pa na yang 'dzin par snang ba med par grub ste /
translated: When the appearance of an object is established as nonexistent, the appearance of a subject is also established as nonexistent.

original: gzung ba med na 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzung ba med na 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir ro //

original: de las kyang gzung ba dang 'dzin par snang ba med par 'jug pa'i rim gyis grub par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de las kyang gzung ba dang 'dzin par snang ba med par 'jug pa'i rim gyis grub par rig par bya'o //
translated: And from that, one should understand that the nonexistence of the appearance of subject and object is established by stages.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: thog ma med pa'i kun nas ldang ba grub pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgang zhig de bzhin nyid mi shes pa med pa'i gnyis snang ba /
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i kun nas ldang ba grub pa'i phyir ro // gang zhig de bzhin nyid mi shes pa med pa'i gnyis snang ba /
translated: Because the beginningless process of misapprehension is established.

original: @31b phyin ci log gi rgyu de ni thog ma med pa'i kun nas ldang ba yin no //
analyzed: @31b phyin ci log gi rgyu de ni thog ma med pa'i kun nas ldang ba yin no //
translated: The cause of the error of the appearance of duality, which is the nonexistence of suchness, is the beginningless process of misapprehension.

original: des na thog ma med pa'i kun nas ldang ba de grub pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: des na thog ma med pa'i kun nas ldang ba de grub pa'i phyir te /
translated: Therefore, because that beginningless process of misapprehension is established,

original: yongs su grub pa'i phyir na gzung ba dang 'dzin par snang ba med pa yin te /
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i phyir na gzung ba dang 'dzin par snang ba med pa yin te /
translated: Because of its perfect establishment, it is devoid of the appearance of the apprehended object and apprehending subject.

original: phyin ci log rnam pa gnyis yang dag pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyin ci log rnam pa gnyis yang dag pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the two kinds of error are not real.

original: 'di las kyang gzung ba dang 'dzin par snang ba med do //
analyzed: 'di las kyang gzung ba dang 'dzin par snang ba med do //
translated: And here too, the appearance of the apprehended object and apprehending subject does not exist.

original: gang las she na /
analyzed: gang las she na /
translated: From what?

original: gnyis yongs su ma grub par rab tu grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis yongs su ma grub par rab tu grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the perfect establishment of the non-establishment of the duality.

original: gnyis yongs su ma grub par yang 'gal ba'i rnam par shes pa skye bar mthong ba la sogs pa'i rgyu las rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: gnyis yongs su ma grub par yang 'gal ba'i rnam par shes pa skye bar mthong ba la sogs pa'i rgyu las rtogs par bya'o //
translated: The non-establishment of the duality should be understood from the cause of the arising of consciousness in the aspect of the negation.

original: gang gis de ltar yongs su shes pa de ni chos la 'jug pa bla na med pa yin no zhes brjod do //
analyzed: gang gis de ltar yongs su shes pa de ni chos la 'jug pa bla na med pa yin no zhes brjod do //
translated: It is said that he who knows it in this way has the unsurpassed entry into the Dharma.

original: chos la 'jug pa bshad zin to //
analyzed: chos la 'jug pa bshad zin to //
translated: The entry into the Dharma has been explained.

original: gang gi phyir da ni chos nyid la 'jug pa brjod par bya ba yin pas de'i dbang du byas te gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: gang gi phyir da ni chos nyid la 'jug pa brjod par bya ba yin pas de'i dbang du byas te gsungs pa ni /
translated: Now, since the entry into reality should be stated, it is said with reference to that:

original: rnam pa drug gis chos nyid la 'jug pa la bla na med pa yin te zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rnam pa drug gis chos nyid la 'jug pa la bla na med pa yin te zhes bya ste /
translated: The entry into reality is unsurpassed through six aspects.

original: 'chad par 'gyur ba drug gis so //
analyzed: 'chad par 'gyur ba drug gis so //
translated: by means of the sixfold explanation that will be given.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: The sixfold explanation is as follows:

original: mtshan nyid dang / gnas dang / nges par rtog pa dang / reg pa dang / rjes su dran pa dang / de'i bdag nyid du nye bar son pa la 'jug pas so //
analyzed: mtshan nyid dang / gnas dang / nges par rtog pa dang / reg pa dang / rjes su dran pa dang / de'i bdag nyid du nye bar son pa la 'jug pas so //
translated: in terms of characteristic, basis, ascertainment, contact, recollection, and the attainment of its identity.

original: de la mtshan nyid ni gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa dang / brjod par bya ba dang / rjod par byed pa khyad par med pa'i de bzhin nyid ni chos nyid kyi mtshan nyid do zhes bya ba mdo ji lta ba bzhin no //
analyzed: de la mtshan nyid ni gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa dang / brjod par bya ba dang / rjod par byed pa khyad par med pa'i de bzhin nyid ni chos nyid kyi mtshan nyid do zhes bya ba mdo ji lta ba bzhin no //
translated: The characteristic of reality is suchness, which is the non-differentiation of the apprehended object, apprehending subject, that which is expressed, and that which expresses.

original: de la gnas ni chos thams cad dang / gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis su gtogs pa'i mdo sde thams cad do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de la gnas ni chos thams cad dang / gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis su gtogs pa'i mdo sde thams cad do zhes bya ba la /
translated: The basis is all things and all scriptures belonging to the twelve branches of the teaching.

original: chos thams cad ni gzugs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni gzugs la sogs pa'o //
translated: All things are form, etc.

original: yan lag bcu gnyis ni mdo dang dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yan lag bcu gnyis ni mdo dang dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The twelve branches are the discourses, aphorisms in verse, etc.

original: gnyis smos pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang bas bsdus pa'i dbang du byed pas so //
analyzed: gnyis smos pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang bas bsdus pa'i dbang du byed pas so //
translated: The repetition of the two terms ‚Äúall things‚Äù and ‚Äúall scriptures‚Äù is for the purpose of including the afflicted and the pure.

original: de la nges par rtog pa ni /
analyzed: de la nges par rtog pa ni /
translated: The path of preparation is the process of ascertaining that.

original: theg pa chen po'i mdo sde la brten pa'i tshul bzhin du yid la byed pas bsdus pa'i sbyor ba'i lam thams cad do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i mdo sde la brten pa'i tshul bzhin du yid la byed pas bsdus pa'i sbyor ba'i lam thams cad do zhes bya ba la /
translated: The path of preparation is all the processes of mental attention that are included in the path of preparation and are based on the scriptural collections of the universal vehicle.

original: thams cad ni thos pa dang / bsams pa dang / bsgoms pas rab tu phye ba ste /
analyzed: thams cad ni thos pa dang / bsams pa dang / bsgoms pas rab tu phye ba ste /
translated: All refers to the three varieties of mental attention that are distinguished by hearing, reflection, and meditation.

original: des de la nges par rtog pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde la reg pa ni yang dag pa'i lta ba thob pa'i phyir mthong ba'i lam @32a * //
analyzed: des de la nges par rtog pa'i phyir ro // de la reg pa ni yang dag pa'i lta ba thob pa'i phyir mthong ba'i lam @32a * //
translated: It is the process of ascertaining that because it is the process of ascertaining that.üîΩContact is the attainment of suchness by the path of vision.

original: gyis mngon sum gyi tshul du de bzhin nyid thob cing nyams su myong ba'o zhes bya ba la reg pa ni mthong ba'i lam gyis de bzhin nyid so sor rig pa yin la /
analyzed: gyis mngon sum gyi tshul du de bzhin nyid thob cing nyams su myong ba'o zhes bya ba la reg pa ni mthong ba'i lam gyis de bzhin nyid so sor rig pa yin la /
translated: Contact is the direct realization of suchness by the path of vision.

original: de yang thob cing nyams su myong ba zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de yang thob cing nyams su myong ba zhes brjod do //
translated: It is said that one attains and experiences suchness.

original: thob pa nyid nyams su myong ba ni /üîΩthob cing nyams su myong ba zhes bya bas so //
analyzed: thob pa nyid nyams su myong ba ni / thob cing nyams su myong ba zhes bya bas so //
translated: Attainment is experience.üîΩAttainment and experience are one.

original: yang nyams su myong ba 'di ji ltar rnam par gzhag par bya zhe na /
analyzed: yang nyams su myong ba 'di ji ltar rnam par gzhag par bya zhe na /
translated: How is experience to be established?

original: gsungs pa / mngon sum gyi tshul du'o //
analyzed: gsungs pa / mngon sum gyi tshul du'o //
translated: In the manner of direct perception.

original: mngon sum du byed pa gang yin pa de nyid nyams su myong ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don du 'di ston pa yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum du byed pa gang yin pa de nyid nyams su myong ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don du 'di ston pa yin no //
translated: The meaning is that what is made directly perceived is itself experienced.

original: reg pa'i don de dag tu rjes su dran pa yin pas de ston pa ni /
analyzed: reg pa'i don de dag tu rjes su dran pa yin pas de ston pa ni /
translated: Since it is a recollection of those objects of contact, it is taught:

original: rjes su dran pa ni de'i dri ma drungs dbyung ba'i don du ji ltar mthong ba nyid bsgom pa'i lam byang chub kyi phyogs kyis bsdus pa thams cad do zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rjes su dran pa ni de'i dri ma drungs dbyung ba'i don du ji ltar mthong ba nyid bsgom pa'i lam byang chub kyi phyogs kyis bsdus pa thams cad do zhes bya'o //
translated: Recollection is for the purpose of eradicating its taints, just as it was seen, in all that is included in the path of cultivation of the factors of awakening.

original: de la mthong ba'i lam gyis de ma thag pa'i bsgom pa'i lam de la rjes su dran pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de la mthong ba'i lam gyis de ma thag pa'i bsgom pa'i lam de la rjes su dran pa zhes brjod do //
translated: In this regard, that path of cultivation immediately following the path of seeing is called recollection.

original: thob zin pa'i lam de yongs su gcod pa'i rjes su dran pas mngon du phyogs par byed do //
analyzed: thob zin pa'i lam de yongs su gcod pa'i rjes su dran pas mngon du phyogs par byed do //
translated: By the recollection of that path which has already been attained, one turns towards it.

original: de yang ci'i don du zhe na /
analyzed: de yang ci'i don du zhe na /
translated: And for what purpose is that?üîΩIt is said:

original: gsungs pa / de'i dri ma drungs dbyung ba'i don du ste /
analyzed: gsungs pa / de'i dri ma drungs dbyung ba'i don du ste /
translated: For the purpose of eradicating its taints.

original: de bzhin nyid la bsgoms pas spang bar bya ba'i mtshan nyid kyi dri ma lhag ma spang ba'i don du'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid la bsgoms pas spang bar bya ba'i mtshan nyid kyi dri ma lhag ma spang ba'i don du'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: and the meaning of ‚Äúin order to abandon the remaining stains that have the characteristic of being abandoned through meditation on suchness.‚Äù

original: rjes su dran pa'i de ma thag tu de'i bdag nyid du nye bar son pa yin pas de ston pa ni /
analyzed: rjes su dran pa'i de ma thag tu de'i bdag nyid du nye bar son pa yin pas de ston pa ni /
translated: Immediately after recollection, one arrives at the nature of that, and therefore it is taught:

analyzed: de'i bdag nyid du nye bar son pa ni de bzhin nyid dri ma med par gyur pa na thams cad de bzhin nyid tsam du snang ba zhes bya ba la //
translated: ‚ÄúWhen suchness becomes stainless, everything appears as just suchness.‚Äù

original: de la bsgom pa'i lam gyis dri ma lhag ma spangs pa'i phyir de bzhin nyid dri ma med par gyur pa na gang zhig mthar thug pa'i lam gyis rnam pa thams cad nas de bzhin nyid tsam du snang ba ste /
analyzed: de la bsgom pa'i lam gyis dri ma lhag ma spangs pa'i phyir de bzhin nyid dri ma med par gyur pa na gang zhig mthar thug pa'i lam gyis rnam pa thams cad nas de bzhin nyid tsam du snang ba ste /
translated: On the path of meditation, the remaining stains are abandoned, and when suchness becomes stainless, everything appears as just suchness on the path of complete accomplishment.

original: dri ma thams cad dang bral bas de bzhin nyid tsam du gyur pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dri ma thams cad dang bral bas de bzhin nyid tsam du gyur pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because one is free from all stains, suchness becomes just suchness.

original: de tsam du yul du gyur pa de ni de'i bdag nyid du nye bar son pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de tsam du yul du gyur pa de ni de'i bdag nyid du nye bar son pa zhes brjod do //
translated: That which becomes an object in that way is said to ‚Äúarrive at the nature of that.‚Äù

original: de yang gnas yongs su gyur pa yongs su grub pa yin te de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang gnas yongs su gyur pa yongs su grub pa yin te de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, the transformation of the basis is the perfected nature because it is of its nature.

original: mthong ba'i lam la sogs pa'i gnas skabs na yang yongs su gyur pa yod pas na /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam la sogs pa'i gnas skabs na yang yongs su gyur pa yod pas na /
translated: Even in the states of the path of insight and so on, there is a transformation,

original: 'di la yongs su grub par bstan te /
analyzed: 'di la yongs su grub par bstan te /
translated: and so it is taught here as perfected,

original: dri ma ma lus spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dri ma ma lus spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because of the abandonment of all defilements without exception.

original: gnas yongs su gyur pa de la yang @32b ji ltar 'jug par bya zhing /
analyzed: gnas yongs su gyur pa de la yang @32b ji ltar 'jug par bya zhing /
translated: Moreover, how is one to enter into that transformation of the basis?

analyzed: ji ltar de la zhugs pa bla na med par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: And how does one become unsurpassed in entering into it?üîΩIt is said:

analyzed: gsungs pa / rnam pa bcus gnas yongs su gyur pa la 'jug pa bla na med pa yin te zhes bya ste /
translated: The unsurpassed entry into the transformation of the basis is by way of ten aspects.

original: 'chad par 'gyur ba rnam pa bcus so //
analyzed: 'chad par 'gyur ba rnam pa bcus so //
translated: It is by way of the ten aspects that will be explained.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: rang bzhin dang / dngos po dang / gang zag dang ; khyad par dang / dgos pa dang / rten dang / yid la byed pa dang / sbyor ba dang / nyes dmigs dang / phan yon la 'jug pas so //
analyzed: rang bzhin dang / dngos po dang / gang zag dang ; khyad par dang / dgos pa dang / rten dang / yid la byed pa dang / sbyor ba dang / nyes dmigs dang / phan yon la 'jug pas so //
translated: entry by way of nature, entity, person, distinction, purpose, reliance, mental attention, application, disadvantage, and benefit.

original: de la dang por rang bzhin la 'jug pa ni glo bur gyi dri ma dang / de bzhin nyid mi snang ba dang / snang ba'i don du de bzhin nyid dri ma med pa'o ;
analyzed: de la dang por rang bzhin la 'jug pa ni glo bur gyi dri ma dang / de bzhin nyid mi snang ba dang / snang ba'i don du de bzhin nyid dri ma med pa'o ;
translated: The first, the entry into the nature, is the entry into the nature of the adventitious stain, the non-appearance of thusness, and the stainless thusness as the object of appearance.

original: / glo bur gyi dri ma mi snang ba'i don dang / de bzhin nyid tsam snang ba'i don du de bzhin nyid dri ma med par gyur pa gang yin pa de ni gnas yongs su gyur pa'i rang bzhin yin no //

translated: The stainless thusness is the nature of the transformation, in the sense of the non-appearance of the adventitious stain and the appearance of just thusness as the object.

original: gang zhig de ltar yongs su shes pa de la ni rang bzhin la 'jug pa bla na med pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: gang zhig de ltar yongs su shes pa de la ni rang bzhin la 'jug pa bla na med pa zhes brjod do //
translated: The one who thus fully knows is said to have the unexcelled entry into the nature.

original: de la dngos po la 'jug pa ni thun mong pa snod kyi rnam par rig pa'i de bzhin nyid yongs su gyur pa dang / mdo sde'i chos kyi dbyings kyi de bzhin nyid yongs su gyur pa dang / thun mong ma yin pas sems can gyi khams kyi de bzhin nyid yongs su gyur pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de la dngos po la 'jug pa ni thun mong pa snod kyi rnam par rig pa'i de bzhin nyid yongs su gyur pa dang / mdo sde'i chos kyi dbyings kyi de bzhin nyid yongs su gyur pa dang / thun mong ma yin pas sems can gyi khams kyi de bzhin nyid yongs su gyur pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The entry into the thing is the transformation of the common, the receptacle consciousness, the transformation of the thusness of the Dharma realm of the sutra collection, and the transformation of the thusness of the uncommon sentient being realm.

original: gnas yongs su gyur pa'i dngos po ni de bzhin nyid rnam pa gsum yongs su gyur pa ste /
analyzed: gnas yongs su gyur pa'i dngos po ni de bzhin nyid rnam pa gsum yongs su gyur pa ste /
translated: The reality of the transformation is the transformation of the three aspects of suchness.

original: de'i rjes su song ba'i dbye ba las kyang 'bras bu'i dbye ba las so //
analyzed: de'i rjes su song ba'i dbye ba las kyang 'bras bu'i dbye ba las so //
translated: The result is classified according to the classification of the subsequent path.

analyzed: snang ba dang / 'doms pa dang / kun du ston pa'i 'bras bu tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The result is distinguished as the result of vision, the result of instruction, and the result of demonstration.

original: de la gang zag la 'jug pa ni dang po gnyis ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams nyid kyi de bzhin nyid yongs su gyur pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de la gang zag la 'jug pa ni dang po gnyis ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams nyid kyi de bzhin nyid yongs su gyur pa yin gyi /
translated: In this regard, the first two transformations are the transformation of suchness of the buddhas and bodhisattvas themselves,

analyzed: gzhan gyi ni ma yin te thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir ro // phyi ma ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi yang yin la /
translated: but not of others, because they are not common.üîΩThe latter is common because it is the transformation of suchness of the sravakas and pratyekabuddhas

analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi yang yin pas thun mong pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and also of the buddhas and bodhisattvas.

original: de la khyad par la 'jug pa ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi zhing yongs su dag pa'i khyad par dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de la khyad par la 'jug pa ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi zhing yongs su dag pa'i khyad par dang zhes bya ba la /

translated: The thorough knowledge of the antidote isüîΩthe non-imaginative wisdom which is the antidote to the five kinds of grasping at unreality:

original: med par 'dzin pa rnam pa lnga'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: med par 'dzin pa rnam pa lnga'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: the unreality of the person, of the object, of transformation, of difference, and of deprecation.

original: med par 'dzin pa rnam pa lnga'i gnyen po ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes yin no zhes de ltar shes pa gang yin pa de la ni gnyen po yongs su shes pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: med par 'dzin pa rnam pa lnga'i gnyen po ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes yin no zhes de ltar shes pa gang yin pa de la ni gnyen po yongs su shes pa zhes brjod do //
translated: The thorough knowledge of the antidote is the knowledge that the non-imaginative wisdom is the antidote to the five kinds of grasping at unreality.

original: med par 'dzin pa rnam pa lnga ni med pa'i chos 'dzin pa dang / med pa'i gang zag 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: med par 'dzin pa rnam pa lnga ni med pa'i chos 'dzin pa dang / med pa'i gang zag 'dzin pa ste /
translated: The five kinds of grasping at non-existence are: grasping at the non-existence of things, grasping at the non-existence of persons,

original: don dam par 'dzin pa'o /
analyzed: don dam par 'dzin pa'o /
translated: grasping at the non-existence of the ultimate,

original: med pa'i yongs su gyur pa 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: med pa'i yongs su gyur pa 'dzin pa ste /
translated: grasping at the non-existence of transformation,

original: chos rnams skye ba dang 'gag par 'dzin pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: chos rnams skye ba dang 'gag par 'dzin pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: and grasping at the non-existence of origination and cessation of things.

original: med pa tha dad pa 'dzin pa ni chos dang chos nyid dag so so bar mngon par zhen pa'i phyir ro //üîΩmed pa'i skur ba nyid 'dzin pa ni chos dang gang @35a * //
analyzed: med pa tha dad pa 'dzin pa ni chos dang chos nyid dag so so bar mngon par zhen pa'i phyir ro // med pa'i skur ba nyid 'dzin pa ni chos dang gang @35a * //
translated: Grasping at the non-existence of difference is the adherence to the separateness of things and their reality.

original: zag dag brtags par yod pa la yang skur pa 'debs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zag dag brtags par yod pa la yang skur pa 'debs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Grasping at the non-existence of deprecation is the deprecation of the imagined existence of things and persons.

original: de la mtshan nyid yongs su shes pa ni yid la mi byed pa dang / yang dag par 'das pa dang / nye bar zhi ba dang / ngo bo nyid kyi don dang / mngon rtags su byed pa ste /
analyzed: de la mtshan nyid yongs su shes pa ni yid la mi byed pa dang / yang dag par 'das pa dang / nye bar zhi ba dang / ngo bo nyid kyi don dang / mngon rtags su byed pa ste /
translated: Here, the knowledge of the characteristics is by way of the five: non-attention, transcendence, pacification, the meaning of intrinsic reality, and the sign.

original: rnam pa lnga spangs pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid kyis so //
analyzed: rnam pa lnga spangs pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid kyis so //
translated: It is by way of the intrinsic identity free from the five aspects.

original: re zhig rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes de rnam par rtog pa yid la mi byed pas ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i rang bzhin du mi rigs so //
analyzed: re zhig rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes de rnam par rtog pa yid la mi byed pas ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i rang bzhin du mi rigs so //
translated: First, it is not reasonable that nonconceptual wisdom is nonconceptual by virtue of not engaging in conceptual thought.

original: gal te rnam par rtog pa yid la mi byed pas rnam par mi rtog pa yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te rnam par rtog pa yid la mi byed pas rnam par mi rtog pa yin na ni /
translated: If it were nonconceptual by virtue of not engaging in conceptual thought,

original: de la bu chung dang byis pa la sogs pa'i shes pa yang rnam par mi rtog par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la bu chung dang byis pa la sogs pa'i shes pa yang rnam par mi rtog par 'gyur te /
translated: then the consciousnesses of infants, small children, and so on would be nonconceptual.

original: gang gi phyir de dag kyang gnas skabs de'i tshe rnam par rtog par mi byed pas so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de dag kyang gnas skabs de'i tshe rnam par rtog par mi byed pas so //
translated: This is because at that stage they do not engage in conceptual thought.

original: rnam par rtog pa las yang dag par 'das pa'i rang bzhin yang yin par rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa las yang dag par 'das pa'i rang bzhin yang yin par rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is also not reasonable that it has a nature that completely transcends conceptual thought.

original: gal te yang dag par 'das pa'i rang bzhin de yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te yang dag par 'das pa'i rang bzhin de yin na ni /
translated: If it had a nature that completely transcends conceptual thought,

original: de las bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par zhugs pa yang der 'gyur te /
analyzed: de las bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par zhugs pa yang der 'gyur te /
translated: then those who have entered meditative attainment in the second concentration and so on would have it,

original: rtog dpyod med pa la rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtog dpyod med pa la rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are free of conception and discernment.

original: rnam par rtog pa nye bar zhi ba'i rang bzhin yang yin par mi rigs te ;
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa nye bar zhi ba'i rang bzhin yang yin par mi rigs te ;
translated: It is also not reasonable that it has the nature of the pacification of conceptuality.

original: gal te rnam par rtog pa nye bar zhi bas rnam par mi rtog pa yin na ni des na gnyid log pa dang / myos pa dang / brgyal ba rnams kyang der 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te rnam par rtog pa nye bar zhi bas rnam par mi rtog pa yin na ni des na gnyid log pa dang / myos pa dang / brgyal ba rnams kyang der 'gyur te /
translated: If non-conceptuality is due to the pacification of conceptuality, then sleep, intoxication, and fainting would be it,

original: gang gi phyir de dag kyang gnas skabs de'i tshe rnam par rtog par mi byed pas so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de dag kyang gnas skabs de'i tshe rnam par rtog par mi byed pas so //
translated: because in those states conceptuality does not occur.

original: 'on te ngo bo nyid kyi don kho nas rnam par mi rtog pa yin na ni gzugs la sogs pa'i yul yang rnam par rtog par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'on te ngo bo nyid kyi don kho nas rnam par mi rtog pa yin na ni gzugs la sogs pa'i yul yang rnam par rtog par mi 'gyur te /
translated: But if non-conceptuality is due to the very nature of things, then objects such as form would not be conceptual,

original: gang gi phyir de dag kyang g-yo ba med pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa mi byed pas so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de dag kyang g-yo ba med pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa mi byed pas so //
translated: because they do not conceptualize due to being unmoving.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa nyid mngon rtags su byed pa yang de yin par mi rigs so //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa nyid mngon rtags su byed pa yang de yin par mi rigs so //
translated: It is also not reasonable that it is a sign of non-conceptuality.

original: 'di ltar rnam par mi rtog pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam par mi rtog pa'o //
translated: In this way, it is non-conceptual.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'o zhes yid la byed pa bzhin na ni shes pa de skye ba ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'o zhes yid la byed pa bzhin na ni shes pa de skye ba ma yin te /
translated: If it were to be attended to as non-conceptual, that cognition would not arise,

original: rnam par mi rtog par rnam par rtog cing brjod pa'i yid la byed pa yang rnam par rtog pa'i rnam pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog par rnam par rtog cing brjod pa'i yid la byed pa yang rnam par rtog pa'i rnam pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the attention to the non-conceptual, which is conceptual and verbal, is itself a form of conceptualization.

original: de'i phyir shes pa de ni rnam pa 'di lnga'i rang gi @35b mtshan nyid las grol par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir shes pa de ni rnam pa 'di lnga'i rang gi @35b mtshan nyid las grol par rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, that cognition should be understood as free from the intrinsic identity of these five aspects.

original: de la khyad par yongs su shes pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa dang / nyi tshe ba ma yin pa nyid dang / mi gnas pa nyid dang / gtan du ba nyid dang / bla na med pa nyid dang / khyad par rnam pa lngas so //
analyzed: de la khyad par yongs su shes pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa dang / nyi tshe ba ma yin pa nyid dang / mi gnas pa nyid dang / gtan du ba nyid dang / bla na med pa nyid dang / khyad par rnam pa lngas so //
translated: Therein, the thorough knowledge of the distinction is fivefold: non-conceptuality, non-limitation, non-abiding, permanence, and supremacy.

original: shes pa de ni khyad par rnam pa lngas nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi las khyad par du 'phags pas so //
analyzed: shes pa de ni khyad par rnam pa lngas nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi las khyad par du 'phags pas so //
translated: That cognition is distinguished by five aspects, and is superior to that of the Sravakas and Pratyekabuddhas.

original: de la nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams ni mya ngan las 'das pa dang / 'khor ba'i yon tan dang nyes pa la rnam par rtog pa'i phyir na de'i shes pa yang rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: de la nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams ni mya ngan las 'das pa dang / 'khor ba'i yon tan dang nyes pa la rnam par rtog pa'i phyir na de'i shes pa yang rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa yin no //

original: nyi tshe ba yang yin te /
analyzed: nyi tshe ba yang yin te /
translated: It is limited

analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi'i spyi'i mtshan nyid tsam la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it focuses on the mere general characteristics of the four noble truths.

original: gnas pa yang yin te /
analyzed: gnas pa yang yin te /
translated: It is a resting place

original: mya ngan las 'das pa la gnas pas so //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa la gnas pas so //
translated: because it rests in nirvƒÅ·πáa.

original: gtan du ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gtan du ba yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not permanent

analyzed: phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das par 'chad pa'i phyir te /
translated: because it is explained as being the nirvƒÅ·πáa without remainder of the aggregates.
